definition: to feel sb's pulse
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to cut/to slice/tangent (math)
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]

sentences.english: Disclosed is an automatic sounding and counting instrument for pulse which is a medical apparatus suitable for feeling the pulse in traditional Chinese medical treatment.
sentences.chinese: 脈搏自動發聲計數儀是一種適於中醫切脈的醫療器具。

sentences.english: Palpation consists of two parts: feeling the pulse and taking the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 切脈包括脈診和切脈兩個部隊份。

sentences.english: Palpation consists of two parts: feeling the pulse and taking the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 切脈包括脈診和切脈兩個部隊份。

definition: (TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)

(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
twelve channels of TCM
auriculotherapy (ear acupuncture)
location on wrist over the radial artery where pulse is taken in TCM
joint (of the skeleton)
symptom (of a disease)
to shiver
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
micro-/microscopic/to make the minute visible
